Key Match Events: The Yankees swept Fenway Park doubleheader for the first time since 2006.
Aaron Boone got his 500th win as a manager.
The Yankees are back above.500 and no longer alone at the bottom of the AL East.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's performance and getting his 500th win.
The win marked a significant turnaround for the Yankees, who are now back above.500 and no longer alone at the bottom of the AL East.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Fenway Park in Boston, Massachusetts, in front of an attendance of 30,392.
The Yankees and Red Sox are in the middle of a four-game series, with the Yankees currently leading 3-1.
Others: The game was broadcast on TBS and covered by ESPN Analytics.
The Yankees' win marked their first sweep of a doubleheader at Fenway Park since 2006.
